column4: so what would I look at as to why 7.04 x86-64 wouldn't boot on my AMD64 system?
the error message
none; it starts loading and goes to a black screen.
uh-huh, what about the lights on the cdrom and hdd?
None. It goes quiet. This is the 7.04 livecd
okay, do you have anything other than ther keyboard, mouse, monitor, speakers plugged in?
no
do you have another computer?
only the one x86-64
oh. what cpu is it?
AMD Sempron 64. It ran 6.04-x86-64 without a problem
AFAIK, 7.04 isn't a final stable release yet.
you may need to tweak the boot options for the kernel
i really don't know what else to suggest other than try a 32bit image
the 32-bit image is working fine
try expert mode
would it be worthwhile to reburn the image?
i would try to get the cd to boot with verbosity turned on (so you can see everything that's going on) and without X starting up
all right
how do I get to expert mode?
I got it to boot to system
my bets now would be on X failing to come up properly
